meanings.definition: To keep (several objects) in motion in the air at the same time by repeatedly throwing and catching them.
meanings.sent1: She juggled colorful balls at the circus.
meanings.sent2: He juggled oranges skillfully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled with such ease that everyone laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like juggling too many plates at once.
meanings.sent5: The juggled balls danced in the air like magic.

meanings.definition: To cope with by adroitly balancing.
meanings.sent1: He juggled work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: She juggled her time between studying and playing.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle work and play made him a master multitasker.
meanings.sent4: Balancing work and hobbies felt like juggling on a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: She juggled her priorities with grace and skill.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with usually several things (such as obligations) at one time so as to satisfy often competing requirements.
meanings.sent1: She juggled work, school, and volunteering.
meanings.sent2: He juggled his time between different projects.
meanings.sent3: Juggling work and personal life can be challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent4: Balancing multiple tasks felt like juggling flaming torches.
meanings.sent5: She juggled her commitments with determination and poise.
